required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Registry Trial for Single Port Robot-assisted Nipple Sparing Mastectomy (SPrNSM)
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Registry Trial for Single Port Robot-assisted Nipple Sparing Mastectomy

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

clinical_study.source: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective registry trial to determine the outcomes of single port robot-assisted nipple sparing mastectomy (SPrNSM) utilitzing the SP da Vinci surgical system.

detailed_description.textblock:
Robotic assisted nipple sparing mastectomies with multi-port robots, like the Da Vinci Xi, have been described previously but pose significant hurdles due to the small area like the breast. The Single-Port da Vinci SP (Intuitive Surgical), which was designed for application to small cavity surgery, may be more appropriately suited for this procedure. This is a prospective registry trial to study the outcomes of performing a single-port robot-assisted nipple sparing mastectomy.
Subjects who undergo rNSM and bilateral breast reconstruction of the affected breast via single site small hidden axillary scar technique will be offered participation in the prospective registry trial at their pre-operative visit in the UT Southwestern Breast Clinic. The patient will then be seen at their regularly scheduled clinic appointments at 2 weeks, 1 month, 6 months, and 1 year post operatively at both Breast and Plastics and Reconstructive Surgery (PRS) departments. Outcomes will be tracked in a prospectively kept electronic registry.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of completion of SPrNSM through axillary incision
primary_outcome.description: Measure number of patients who completed surgery with en bloc removal of the breast through axillary incision v. conversion to open incision

primary_outcome.measure: Complication rate of patients requiring re-operation
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients with bleeding requiring a second surgery after SPrNSM

primary_outcome.measure: Complication rate of patients with infection requiring explantation of tissue expander
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients with infection after surgery requiring explantation of tissue expander

primary_outcome.measure: Complication rate of patients with mastectomy flap necrosis
primary_outcome.description: number of patients with skin, or nipple-areolar flap necrosis using SKIN flap score

primary_outcome.measure: Operative surgery time trends with peri-operative outcomes
primary_outcome.description: Measure total surgery time in relation to other outcomes in each patient

secondary_outcome.description: Patient satisfaction is measured using BREAST-Q. Possible scores range from 1-10 Likert scale, with higher scores indicating better/ worse outcome.
Skin and nipple sensation post operatively with Semmes Weinstein monofilament exam

clinical_study.condition: Anatomic Stage IA Breast Cancer AJCC v8
Anatomic Stage IB Breast Cancer AJCC v8
Anatomic Stage IIA Breast Cancer AJCC v8
Anatomic Stage II Breast Cancer AJCC v8
Anatomic Stage I Breast Cancer AJCC v8
Anatomic Stage IIB Breast Cancer AJCC v8
Anatomic Stage IIIA Breast Cancer AJCC v8
Prognostic Stage I Breast Cancer AJCC v8
Prognostic Stage II Breast Cancer AJCC v8

study_pop.textblock: Adult women who undergo robotic nipple sparing mastectomy (rNSM) with reconstruction.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects age >= 18 years who undergo robotic nipple sparing mastectomy and breast reconstruction with prosthesis at UTSW
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects who are <18 years of age
2. Subjects who do not undergo robotic nipple sparing mastectomy and breast reconstruction with prosthesis at UTSW

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

patient_data.ipd_description: The study share data of individual participants.
